RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 43000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwi se Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALTERINA forwardly placed from the start, came under a light rating hold and was latched on the leader three wide early on, tucked to the two path down the backstretch and was patiently handled until placed to coaxing near the five-sixteenths as the leader attempted to slip away under challenge, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, rallied to come again issuing a challenge inside the final furlong taking command from a drifting out leader near the sixteenth marker, then edged away to the finish kept to task. STRANGE FRUIT established the front and showed the way rated on the pace along the inside, took to the two path through the far turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole under challenge from the outside in SHOTGUN PATSY, swung four wide into upper stretch, shook off that rival drifting out through to the finish despite a right handed crop and was caught a sixteenth out, then ran on getting corrected with a tug on the left rein and was along clear of the rest and second best. SHOTGUN PATSY traded a bump at the start with POWER AND GLORY, chased two to three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, offered up a bid swinging six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive angling in two paths near the sixteenth pole and weakened in the late stages. CAUSE I'M ELEGANT bobbled at the break, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three wide into upper stretch and stayed on one paced through to the finish. POWER AND GLORY traded a bump at the start with SHOTGUN PATSY, chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, tucked inside at the three-eighths, cut the corner into upper stretch and shied from the crop of the rider of ALTERINA directly in front and weakened to the finish. GO SUSAN GO chased three then two wide coming under coaxing half a mile from home, took the inside route into upper stretch, made no impact. BELLA SONADORA stumbled at the start conceding five to six lengths to the front before being able to settle into stride, chased along the inside through the opening bend well behind at the tail of the field, came under coaxing just off the inside half a mile from home, continued just off the inside into upper stretch, trailed throughout and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Bella Sonadora
ENTRY.OWNER: Figueroa Kim B and Albert Linda A
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled st, chased ins, coaxed 2w 1/2p, 2w 1/4, trailed, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Shotgun Patsy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 2-3w, bid 6w upper, dug in, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Power and Glory
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, ins 3/8, ins 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Strange Fruit
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated on pace ins, coaxed 2p near 1/4, 4w uppr, drifted, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Cause I'm Elegant
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Alterina
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3-2w in aim, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, up 1/16, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Go Susan Go
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 1/2p, inside 1/4, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 5 1/2F Turf CR: 79. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DETECTIVE TOM came away alertly and went straight to the front, showed the way under pressure to his outside, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked outside the quarter-pole, lost the advantage to the runner-up into upper stretch, dueled gamely inside that foe to the wire and narrowly prevailed in a head-bobbing finish. INSTAMATIC moved up between foes under urging, pressed the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, was given his cue coming to the quarter-pole, took a short lead into upper stretch, dueled determinedly outside of the winner to the finish and was denied while able to get the place. PRICE IS TRUTH was well placed just off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was roused while shifting three wide into upper stretch then came under the crop, pursued the top two into the final sixteenth, gained some late but missed while able to get the show. ROB THE BANK settled off the pace, went around most of the turn in the two path then shifted three wide, was roused four wide into the stretch then moved further out, found his best stride in the final furlong and finished with good energy but was too late while up for the last spot in the superfecta. PATRONAGE was last to commence then hustled, raced outside under urging, angled in near the half-mile pole, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn, came seven wide into upper stretch and improved position with late energy. SEBASTIANTHE FIRST became restless in the gate when a neighbor to his inside was fractious, was sent hard from the gate then urged along on the outside, went four wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and gained in the final furlong but failed to impact. SCORE THE ROCK came inward at the start then moved out early, was urged along off the pace, lugged out some while inside to the two path on the turn, steadied inside the five-sixteenths and lacked the needed response. MITHRIDATES was coaxed along off the pace, saved ground on the turn and came up empty. KING FREUD settled towards the rear, dropped from the three path to the rail on the turn, spun into the stretch in the two path, gained some in the final furlong, was taken in hand behind horses late and failed to threaten. CLAVINET was fractious in the gate, broke in and hit the gate, was coaxed along just off the pace, went three wide while put to stronger encouragement on the turn, was driven four wide into the stretch and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Clavinet
ENTRY.OWNER: Adelphi Racing Club Cutair Racing Beitz Kenneth G Beitz Gail P Weintraub Tony an
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,hit gate,coaxed,3w turn,4w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Score the Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,left-rein guidance ins-2p trn,stdy ins 5/16,mild gain

ENTRY.NAME: Mithridates
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along,inside turn,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Detective Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,set pressured pace,2p turn,headed3/16,dueled,gamely

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Twin Farms, LLC, Thomas N Mina & WalterS Borisenok

ENTRY.NAME: Price Is Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,ins turn,shifted 3w1/4,chased duo,gained,missed

ENTRY.NAME: Rob the Bank
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,2-3path turn,ask4w1/4,moved out,good energy,missed tri

ENTRY.NAME: Instamatic
ENTRY.COMMENT: mvd up btwn,press outside,3p turn,lead3/16,dueled,denied

ENTRY.NAME: King Freud
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Rudy R and Witz Frank
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled towards rear,3path-ins turn,2p1/4,late gain,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Sebastianthe First
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate,sent hard,urged outside,4w turn,6w1/4,late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Patronage
ENTRY.OWNER: St Elias Stable Langone Ken Duncker C Steven and Vicarage Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,urged outside,mvd in 1/2,ins-3w turn,7w1/4,improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 103. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 162500. INNER TURF (PURSE $125,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $28,275 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 THREE TIMES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $80,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $80,000 (All owance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAND SONATA broke out a step at the start bumping SAFE CONDUCT, tracked the pace along the inside, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, got roused at the three-sixteenths when a seam opened up between foes, split foes rallying at the eighth pole before taking command inside that station, then dug in confronted by EASTER and gamely repelled that foe to the finish. EASTER (FR) broke a half a beat slow and hit the near side stall at the start, tracked the front just off the inside from the tail of the field, remained patiently handled until set down angled four to five wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong tussling with the aforementioned foe through the final sixteenth but was ultimately rebuffed at the end. KURAMATA (IRE) two to three wide in pursuit in closest aim of the leader, at times latched on, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung three wide into upper stretch, rallied to take command a furlong out before being displaced from command just inside that station, then got outkicked through the late stages while along for the show honors. UNANIMOUS CONSENT (GB) tracked the front two to three wide coming under a drive at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late going. MAIN EVENT established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside, tucked inside through the first turn before taking to the two path once more down the backstretch through sensible splits, tucked inside into the far turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole before being set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, yielded the front nearing the eighth pole, then weakened through the final furlong. SAFE CONDUCT got bumped at the start by GRAND SONATA, who broke out a step, saved ground near the rear of the field, got let out angled three wide into upper stretch, came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Sonata
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, tracked ins, 2w 1/4p, split foes 1/8, up, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Safe Conduct
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, saved grd near rear, let out 3w upper, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Easter (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, tracked 2p, set down 4-5w upper, rallied, rebuffed

ENTRY.NAME: Main Event
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, inside in turns, set down ins 1/4, yielded, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Unanimous Consent (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2-3w, coaxed 5/16, angled 4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Kuramata (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coax near 1/4, 3w uppr, up 1/8, collared, outkicked

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 98. Claiming Purse 46000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR THREE YEAR OLDS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLASSIC MARK broke a step slow then was hustled, angled out early then moved to the lead while dropping from the four path to the two path on the first turn, showed the way with a clear advantage while off the rail, was asked in the two path inside the three-eighths pole, came under a right-handed crop into upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop at the furlong marker, went back to a right-handed crop and was given one pop near the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a strong hand-ride to the wire while best. BIG BOBBY was taken in hand while forced out early, went five then four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused four wide on the far turn, chased the winner outside in the stretch and narrowly earned the place. COMPLETE AGENDA was taken in hand while forced out early, dropped from the three path to the rail on the first turn, was well placed just off the pace, came under urging leaving the backstretch, chased inside on the far turn, pursued the winner in the stretch and just missed the place while narrowly able to get the show. ANTHRACITE was away alertly, went two then three wide on the first turn, tracked the pace on the outside, chased in the three path on the far turn, pursued the winner under a drive in the stretch and just missed the trifecta. UNION LIGHTS leaned in at the start and was off slow, spotted the front a few lengths, was taken in hand while having his path taken early on the first turn, went two then three wide on that bend, settled towards the back, moved out near the five-eighths pole, was roused three wide on the far turn and lacked the needed response. BERT BERT BERT angled in early, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, was urged along while inside on the far turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Bert Bert Bert
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in early,inside turns,failed to respond

ENTRY.NAME: Union Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: leaned in,off slow,path taken early,2-3path turns,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Mark
ENTRY.OWNER: Rice Linda and Italian Stallions Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slw brk,angled out,mvd to front,pace,2p2nd,responded,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Anthracite
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly,2-3p1st,tracked outside,chsd 3p2nd turn,missed tri

ENTRY.NAME: Complete Agenda
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out early,3p-ins1st,well placed,chased ins2nd,missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Big Bobby
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out early,5-4p1st,settled out,ask4w2nd,up for place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 88000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LADY ARWEN chased along the inside briefly before tipping three wide down the backstretch, tucked to the two path into the turn advancing to take command nearing the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, drifted in to the two path straightened away, drew clear under a drive to the eighth pole, held clear under a light drive to the finish to prevail. AWESOME CZECH four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, ran on to chase the winner home well clear of the rest and along second best. SUN AND WIND showed the way in hand just off the inside down the backstretch, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, got headed near the quarter pole for the front and took the inside route into upper stretch, then weakened in the drive while along for the show honors. HOLDER CLOSE chased three wide under coaxing from the half mile pole, angled five wide into upper stretch, made no impact. BUONA SALUTE chased four paths off the inside until tucked to the rail half a mile from home, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch and tired. MASTERY'S SECRET broke out at the start, chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn and continued three wide into upper stretch, faltered in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Holder Close
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3w, coaxed 1/2p, angled 5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Buona Salute
ENTRY.OWNER: Hibiscus Stables LLC Big Dom Racing Stable Big Toe Stables LLC and Rodriguez Rud
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w backstretch, to ins 1/2, coaxed 3/8, inside 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Arwen
ENTRY.OWNER: Allread Neal M and Gold Star Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins early, chased 3-2w, took over, 3w upper, drew clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Big Dom Racing & Stonegate Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Czech
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 7/16, 4w upper, ran on, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Sun and Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, coaxed ins 5/16, headed, inside 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mastery's Secret
ENTRY.OWNER: Barrera III Oscar S and Sosa-Barrera Clery L
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 5w backstretch, 3w turn, 3w upper, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 5 1/2F Turf CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOSUA SUMMER settled off the pace, was roused three wide on the turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed strongly to get the lead inside the furlong marker, responded well to the threat of the runner-up in the final sixteenth and held under strong urging. FAUCI angled in towards the rear, saved ground on the turn, swung six wide into the stretch then tipped to the seven path, rallied outside to make a bid in the final furlong, fought with the winner in the final sixteenth and just missed while clear for the place. FLUID SITUATION was rated off the pace then taken up late on the backstretch, dropped back into the turn, saved ground on that bend, came off the rail outside the quarter-pole, swung five wide into the stretch then quickly moved to the six path, chased in the drive and got up for the show. MAMBA ON THREE brushed the outside of the gate at the start then bobbled slightly, was sent hard then well placed just off the pace, chased inside on the turn, pursued the leader under a drive into the final furlong and tired. ARTEMUS CITYLIMITS established position towards the front, moved around near the half-mile pole then tracked the pace, chased in the three path on the turn, made a bid under a drive in upper stretch but was out-kicked. NOLO CONTESTO was taken in hand while last away then bobbled after the start, settled at the rear, was urged along in the two path on the turn, moved out in upper stretch and improved position. SENBEI was rated under tight restraint in traffic, dropped back after checking near the seven-sixteenths, went around the turn in the two path, steadied while blocked behind horses at the three-sixteenths then moved in, was completely stymied behind foes in the final furlong and lost all chance. INTO THE SUNRISE angled in while sent hard to the front, vied in the two path on the turn, led under a drive into the final furlong but was overtaken and weakened. SOUPER SUCCESS broke out then was corrected by the rider, was coaxed along on the outside, moved in to race in the two path on the turn, shifted three wide into the stretch, chased into the final furlong and lacked the needed response. OXYMORE was fractious in the gate, settled off the pace, went four then three wide on the turn, spun six wide into the stretch and failed to respond then was protected while not urged in the final furlong. NOBLE EMOTION was taken in hand while crowded between foes early, settled towards the back, moved from three to five wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch and failed to rally. CHUCK WILLIS (IRE) veered out at the start then was corrected by the rider, settled on the far outside, went fix then six wide under extra left-rein pressure on the turn, drifted inward in upper stretch and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Nolo Contesto
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled after brk,at rear,2p turn,mvd out 3/16,improved

ENTRY.NAME: Chuck Willis (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Roman, Lawrence P. and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out brk,settled out,5-6wide turn,drifted in 3/16,empty

ENTRY.OWNER: Paradise Farms Corp Staudacher David and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: towards front,mvd out 1/2,trckd,chsd 3p turn,outkicked

ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,settled,4-3p turn,6w1/4,no response,protected

ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed gate,bobbled tad,sent,well placed,ins turn,chsd,wknd

ENTRY.COMMENT: rated,taken up 7/16,ins-2p,5w1/4,6w3/16,chased,up for show

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,roused 3w turn,5w1/4,rallied,lead ins1/8,responded,held

ENTRY.COMMENT: rated traffic,tkn up7/16,2p,stdied3/16,stymied final1/8,no chance

ENTRY.OWNER: Ryan Michael J and Sutherland Sarah
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand btwn early,settled,3-5w turn,7w1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Into the Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard,angled in,pace,2p turn,led past 1/8,overtaken,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Fauci
ENTRY.OWNER: Lindy Farms and Ice Wine Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,settled,ins turn,swung 6w1/4,7w3/16,rallied,just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Souper Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,coaxed out,2p turn,3p1/4,lacked needed response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET MYSTERY coaxed from the gate, chased two to three wide advancing on the leader placed to coaxing to take command five-sixteenths from home, spun three then two wide into upper stretch, edged clear to the eighth pole, dug in and held safe to prevail. BUSTIN BAY chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four then three wide into upper stretch, ran on to chase the winner home well clear of the rest and along second best. MIA BEA STAR chased just off the inside, tipped three wide into a seam left vacant by the eventual winner just inside the five-sixteenths placed to coaxing, angled six wide into upper stretch and improved position to secure the show honors. B B'S BUSTED coaxed from the start, chased two to three wide through the first turn and down the backstretch and then three then four wide through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened. VALLARAND coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside, came under coaxing near the five-sixteenths, yielded the front at that station, swung three wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 5/16, 4-3w upper, ran on, second best

ENTRY.NAME: B B's Busted
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3-4w 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mia Bea Star
ENTRY.OWNER: Reyana and Reya Racing and Rampersaud Totaram
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, tip 3w urged ins 5/16, 6w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Vallarand
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, coaxed near 5/16, yielded, 3w uppr, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Mystery
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 2-3w pursuit, up 5/16, 2-3w uppr, edged clear, safe

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 52000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Afte rcare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TO A T broke a half-step slow, settled towards the rear, bumped with a rival late on the backstretch, was roused two then three wide on the turn, rallied five wide into the stretch, closed strongly to get the lead inside the furlong marker then moved clear under good handling. TIMED OUT broke a step slow then was hustled, moved up into the middle of the field, paused while taken in hand behind MIDTOWN ROSE as that foe dropped back near the nine-sixteenths, moved from the rail to the two path under urging on the turn, paused while cautiously ridden behind horses in upper stretch, was roused outside the furlong marker, drifted in while chasing near the sixteenth-pole and secured the place. MIDTOWN ROSE was hustled from the gate then chased the pace, dropped back outside the half-mile pole, went three wide on the turn, took the lead in upper stretch, led under a drive into the final furlong but was overtaken by the top two while well clear for the show. MERAVIGLIOSO settled off the pace, was roused four wide on the turn, came seven wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. VITAEMI moved in while going to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, vied inside of a foe while along the rail on the turn, lost the advantage in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and gave way. TRIPLE P broke a half-step slow, settled on the far outside, was urged five wide on the turn, spun seven wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. JACKIE THE JOKER was hustled from the gate, moved outside the leader then stalked the pace on the outside, made a bid at the half-mile pole, vied in the two to three path on the turn, passed the five-sixteenths on even terms for the lead, battled under a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. HAPPY SOPHIA was grabbed by the rider early then taken back, settled at the rear, bumped with a foe late on the backstretch, dropped from the three path to the rail on the turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Timed Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,hustled,paused4-1/2,ins-2p turn,crowded3/16,chased

ENTRY.NAME: To a T
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables Acqua Nova Stable and PlayingTheField Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 step slow,settled,bmpd1/2,2-3p turn,5w1/4,rallied,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Midtown Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,chsd,drop back1/2,mvd out,3p turn,lead ins3/16,overtaken

ENTRY.NAME: Jackie the Joker
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,mvd outside leader,stalked,vied 2-3p turn,even5/16,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Sophia
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand early,taken back,settled,bmp7/16,3p-ins turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Triple P
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 step slow,settled outside,5w turn,7w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Meraviglioso
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 4wide turn, 7w into lane, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Vitaemi
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved in,pace,inside turn,headed inside 3/16,gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Mohegan Sun Ballston Spa S. - Grade2 SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 109. Stakes Purse 300000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $300 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,500 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided accordingly $165,000 to the wi nner, $60,000 to second, $36,000 to third, $18,000 to fourth, $12,000 to fifth and $9,000 divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One sweepstake in 2023 or two Grade Two sweepstakes in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade One in 2022 or a Grade Two sweepstake in 2022-23 or two Graded sweepstakes in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a Graded sweepstake in 2022-23 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the ri
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EVVIE JETS coaxed from the gate, tracked the spirting away duo along the inside through the first turn and down the backstretch, took closer order into the far turn, got roused taking the inside route into upper stretch as the leader stayed committed to the two path, rallied to take command a furlong from home, dug in gamely to fend off all challengers and prevail in a blanket finish on the wire. FLUFFY SOCKS settled just off the inside near the rear of the field, tucked inside into the far turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and angled out three to four wide into upper stretch set down for the drive, rallied to close well through the final furlong and just missed at the end. JUMBLY (GB) just off the inside through the first turn, tracked three wide down the backstretch and through the far turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole before being let out angled five wide into upper stretch, closed well through the final furlong but missed at the finish. GAM'S MISSION tracked just off the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing and got set down spinning three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and had the crop knocked from the rider's right hand just inside the eighth pole, then got out-finished in the late stages. TECHNICAL ANALYSIS (IRE) a bit fractious in the gate prior to the start, dueled early on from the two path with SISTER BRIDGET to her inside, got shaken off a bit into the turn and down the backstretch before advancing to take command seven-sixteenths from home, showed the way through the far turn and was let out spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under a drive got headed a furlong from home, then got out-finished in the late going while running on to the wire. CONSUMER SPENDING just of the inside at the tail of the field, tucked inside into the far turn, got set down swinging three to four wide into upper stretch, tipped out a path at the three-sixteenths and lacked a clear lane, angled in inside the eighth pole all the way to the rail in behind EVVIE JETS and was stymied in the final seventy yards through to the finish. SURPRISINGLY two then three wide through the first turn, chased four then three wide, got set down angled six to seven wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick but was outkicked. SISTER BRIDGET (IRE) coaxed from the gate, dueled with TECHNICAL ANALYSIS to her outside, shook off that foe just off the inside into the first turn and spurted away briefly into the backstretch, floated three then four wide and was headed for command seven-sixteenths from home, chased three to four wide through the far turn, angled two to three wide into upper stretch and weakened in the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Jumbly (GB)

ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p near rear, to ins 7/16, 3-4w upper, late surge, just missed

ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w 1st turn, chased 4-3w, 6-7w upper, mild kick, outkicked

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 10 1 3/16M Turf CR: 85. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Eighth on the Main Track).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOOFAREASTISWEST went three wide on the first turn, settled outside without the benefit of cover, was roused while three then four wide on the far turn, rallied five wide to take the lead before the three-sixteenths, kicked clear into the final furlong, was kept to the task with the crop until outside the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a hand-ride while much the best. WAR OFFICER was taken up while in tight between horses after the start, saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, moved from the two path to the five path on the far turn, came seven wide into the stretch and improved for the place. SACRED RHYME showed speed between foes on the opening straightaway, rounded the first turn in the two path, settled towards the front, was asked in the three path on the far turn, made a bid outside the quarter-pole then led four wide into upper stretch, lost the advantage to the winner outside the furlong marker and proved no match then lost the place but just held the show. JAMESTOWN broke out and hit the gate, moved in towards the rear, settled on the inside, was roused on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch then moved further out and lacked the needed kick then just missed the show. GAME KEEPER was hustled from the gate, rounded the first turn in the three path, settled off the pace, was urged two then three wide on the far turn, was driven five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response. WEYHILL ROAD showed speed on the inside of two foes, set the pace on the inside, was asked near the five-sixteenths, lost the advantage while coming off the rail into upper stretch and gave way. ATLANTIC DANCER moved in early, saved ground on the first turn, settled towards the back, moved from the two path to the four path while roused on the final turn, was driven six wide into the stretch and failed to rally. DR KRINGLE leaned in and hit the gate, showed speed on the outside of two opponents, vied in the three path on the first turn, prompted the pace on the outside, was asked in the two path on the far turn, dropped back into upper stretch and tired. TIMO was hustled from the gate, settled on the inside, was asked on the far turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Weyhill Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Woodford Racing LLC Stonestreet Stables LLC Langone Ken West Point Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed inside,pace,asked 5/16,headed into upper,gave way
